break

A new invocation of a top level loop is called as a subgoal

Description

Used to start a new invocation of the top level loop. Compiled procedures and event handler redefinitions remain valid within the new invocation level. Exiting with a Control-D (or end_of_file) or calling exit_block(end) will return the control to the previous level.

Fail Conditions

None.

Resatisfiable

No.

Examples

[eclipse]: [user].
 go:- writeln("**** Enter prolog goals and press ^D"),
      break,
      writeln("**** Execution continues...").
 user compiled 144 bytes in 0.02 seconds

yes.
[eclipse]: go.
**** Enter prolog goals and press ^D

Entering break level 1
[eclipse]: date(X).

X = "Wed Aug  9 12:21:48 1989\n"
yes.
[eclipse]: ^D

Leaving break level 1
**** Execution continues...

yes.
[eclipse]:
